'''PeaZip''' is a [[file manager]] and [[file archiver]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Linux]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linux.com/feature/127889 |title=Archive files in both Windows and Linux using PeaZip |accessdate=2008-04-09 |author=Federico Kereki |date=2008-03-05 |publisher=[[Linux.com]]}}</ref> It supports its native [[PEA archive format]] (featuring compression, multi volume split and flexible authenticated encryption and integrity check schemes) and other mainstream formats, with special focus on handling open formats.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.download.com/8301-2007_4-9832605-12.html |title=Killer Download: Top file compression alternatives |accessdate=2008-04-09 |author=Jason Parker |date=2007-12-11 |publisher=[[Download.com]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.freedownloadscenter.com/2007/09/26/peazip-compression-software/ |title=PeaZip Compression Software |accessdate=2008-04-09 |author=O. James Fagbire |date=2007-09-26 |publisher=Free Downloads Center}}</ref>
+
'''PeaZip''' is a [[file manager]] and [[file archiver]] for [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Linux]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linux.com/feature/127889 |title=Archive files in both Windows and Linux using PeaZip |accessdate=2008-04-09 |author=Federico Kereki |date=2008-03-05 |publisher=[[Linux.com]]}}</ref> It supports its native [[PEA archive format]] (featuring compression, multi volume split and flexible authenticated encryption and integrity check schemes) and other mainstream formats, with special focus on handling [[open format]]s.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.download.com/8301-2007_4-9832605-12.html |title=Killer Download: Top file compression alternatives |accessdate=2008-04-09 |author=Jason Parker |date=2007-12-11 |publisher=[[Download.com]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.freedownloadscenter.com/2007/09/26/peazip-compression-software/ |title=PeaZip Compression Software |accessdate=2008-04-09 |author=O. James Fagbire |date=2007-09-26 |publisher=Free Downloads Center}}</ref>
PeaZip is mainly written in [[Free Pascal]], using [[Lazarus (software)|Lazarus]]. It is [[free software]], released under the terms of the [[GNU Lesser General Public License]].
PeaZip is mainly written in [[Free Pascal]], using [[Lazarus (software)|Lazarus]]. It is [[free software]], released under the terms of the [[GNU Lesser General Public License]].
